bib.title: Odd-even systematics in neutron fission yields of 233U and 235U

free_txt: same value as in Rider file,
which is the compiled value, but cited as "S.Amiel and
T.Izak-Biran, Nucl. Sci. Eng. (to be published)"
NNDC: converted from RIDER to EXFOR90588
ML: converted to regular EXFOR; comment and
BIB informatio added, EN-MEAN changed.
ML: checked all sources again and revised
BIB section, in particular 'REFERENCE' and the
comment. Changed to lower case and 4-digit year.
BIB update
Compiler's (ML) comment: the origin of the yield value
compiled by B.F.Rider and included here is not clear:
- The Rider file contains the value given in the data
table (Subentry 2) associated with the reference
74AMI2.
- The Rider reference files gives under 74AMI2: 'Amiel,
S., Izak-Biran,T., To be published (1974). Cited in
- For 74AMI1 the Rider reference file states: 'Amiel,
S., Feldstein, H., "Odd-Even Systematics in Neutron
Fission Yields of Uranium Isotopes 233 and 235",
submitted to Phys.Rev.C (July 1974). See 75AMI1'.
- For 75AMI1 the Rider reference file gives Phys.Rev.C
11(1975)845 (which is taken as the main reference for
this entry).
Compiler (ML) assumes that 74AMI1 and 75AMI1 are the
same reference.
- Table IV of Phys.Rev.C 11(1975)845 contains the same
value as the Rider file; therefore it is used as the
main reference for this entry.
- This table contains a footnote b) to the fractional
yield value giving 'Reference 31' as its origin.
Reference 31 is given as: 'S.Amiel and T.Izak-Biran,
Nucl.Sci.Eng. (to be published)'.
The compiler (ML) identified this reference as:
T.Izak-Biran and S.Amiel, "Reevaluation of the Emission
Probabilities of Delayed Neutrons from Fission
Products", Nucl.Sci.Eng. 57(1975)117. (There is no
other paper by these authors in Nucl.Sci.Eng. during
the years 1974-1976). However:
- this reference presents an evaluation of delayed
neutron yields. All data presented are evaluated or
taken from another source.
- It contains for fast fission only delayed neutron
group yields (Table III) but no yields for individual
precursors and hence none for Br-87.
- Even if one assumes that the group 1 consists only of
Br-87, the delayed neutron yield (for 10% odd-even
effect) of 4.8, divided by the given Pn-value of 2.35
for Br-87, gives a cumulative yield of 2.04, which,
divided by the chain yield of 2.55 (given in Table IV
of Phys.Rev.C 11(1975)845 along with the fractional
cumulative yield of 0.87), gives a fractional
cumulative yield of 0.80.
Conclusions:
- Nucl.Sci.Eng. 57(1975)117 is not the source of the
compiled value.
- It is even not known whether the value is the result
of an experiment and whether it originates from this
laboratory.
Therefore it is recommended not to use that value in an
evaluation without any further information on, or
confirmation of, its origin and nature.
Phys.Rev.C 11(1975)845: for bulk of data in Table IV:
fission spectrum with average energy of 1.9 MeV.
no information as original source of data is unknown
reference 74AMI2, checked by ML: see comment
